articles.description: Masters champion and world number three Jon Rahm confirms he is making a shock move to join LIV Golf.
articles.title: Masters champion Rahm confirms switch to LIV Golf

articles.description: Latest news after Everton beat Newcastle, and West Ham edge out Spurs, plus news conferences before the weekend matches.
articles.title: Reaction to wins for Everton and West Ham plus weekend build-up

articles.description: Sports Minister Prince Abdulaziz bin Turki Al Faisal defends Saudi Arabia's right to host the 2034 World Cup in exclusive interview with BBC sports editor Dan Roan.
articles.title: Saudi World Cup sportswashing claims 'very shallow'

articles.description: Former Arsenal star Theo Walcott explains why Bukayo Saka and Gabriel Martinelli are the modern-day wingers he loves to watch.
articles.title: The art of the winger & why Arsenal pair stand out - Walcott

articles.description: Europe will need to "rewrite the rules" for Ryder Cup eligibility following Jon Rahm's move to LIV Golf, says Rory McIlroy.
articles.title: McIlroy wants Ryder Cup change after Rahm LIV move

articles.description: Tottenham captain Son Heung-min says his team-mates "need to take responsibility" as they drop points from a winning position again.
articles.title: Latest Spurs defeat 'unacceptable' - Son

articles.description: Everton climb out of the relegation zone just 20 days after being plunged into it, as Sean Dyche praises the team's mentality and connection.
articles.title: Everton out of bottom three 'psychologically massive'

articles.description: Former world number one Naomi Osaka is targeting the 2024 Paris Olympics and further Grand Slam crowns as she prepares to return to action.
articles.title: Returning Osaka targets place at Paris Olympics

articles.description: Britain's Dakota Ditcheva looks to extend her impressive record of eight finishes in nine fights when she faces Valentina Scatizzi in the PFL Europe finals in Dublin on Friday.
articles.title: 'In the genes' - Ditcheva explains special KO power

articles.description: Erik ten Hag says friends tried to talk him out of taking over as Manchester United manager because they thought he faced an "impossible job".
articles.title: 'Friends tried to talk me out of Man Utd job' - Ten Hag
